Entries.default:
Cortina's voice finds you before she does, her barks of laughter and cheerful directives resounding throughout the mill. She flits from worker to worker, offering critique and approval.

When she finally spots you, a shadow of apprehension passes over her face. She hides it with a toothy grin.
"Farewell."
"What business brings you to my mill?"
"Ah, here you are again."
"If you are here about the taxes, tell the queen-"
"Tell your queen I will have her taxes - her prize-share, whatever it is - by the end of the week. Business is good and we very are busy, eh?"
"You must have me confused with someone else."
[Lie] "I'm sure she'll understand."
"Wait, you are not the tax collector." She narrows her eyes, her hand twitching over the hilt of her blade.
"Her what?"
"Prize-share, I think you call it? But shouldn't you-"
"Good day."
"Oh! You are not the tax collector." She narrows her eyes, her hand twitching at the hilt of her blade.
"What do you do here?"
"Who are you?"
"Cu√®?" Cortina leans in close, one prodigiously furry eyebrow raised.
"You go 'round asking just anyone in Queen's Berth personal questions, maybe you end up dead in a ditch. Have caution, eh?"
"Lucky for you, I am a woman of honor." She gives you a sunny smile and claps her hands together.
"I direct luminous milling for the Vailian Trading Company. Is a nice job, ac? And I am quite good at it."
"You want to know more? Buy me a drink first, perguono." Cortina claps you on the shoulder, a playful smile on her lips.
Cortina looks about the room with exaggerated wonder, her green eyes wide.
"Maybe you cannot see through that thing on your eyes, ac?" She stands on the tips of her toes and leans forward, peering into your face.
"We mill luminous, of course."

She laughs a little to herself and runs a finger across the arm of the chair beside her. She holds the finger up for your inspection.

It's caked in shimmering blue dust.
"Take big chunks, break into smaller chunks, crush into dust-sized chunks..."
"Per complancanet, it is really not so complicated." She gives you a condescending little pat on the arm.
"I need refined luminous adra."
"Hah! I need a large country estate and several handsome women to fan me with palm fronds."
"It is good for the heart to dream impossible dreams, yes?" She gives you a quick nod, then laughs quietly to herself, her large ears twitching.
"The adra belongs to the Vailian Trading Company, aimico. Unless you plan to open a bathhouse to rival the one in Periki's Overlook, we will take no orders from you."
Entries.female: "The adra belongs to the Vailian Trading Company, aimica. Unless you plan to open a bathhouse to rival Ganor's in Periki's Overlook, we will take no orders from you."

Entries.default: "I've done the Vailian Trading Company my share of favors. It's time you do one for me."
[Lie] "If my client likes what you've got, this won't be my last order."
"Forget it, then."
"You would spend that goodwill on this one errand?"
[Wink.] "Surely I needn't spend it all, aimica."
"Just mind your business and make the sale."
"You've got a point."
"Feh, if you insist." She rolls her eyes.
"Feh, if you insist." She rolls her eyes.
"As I said." She winks.
"Your price is two thousand copper. We only sell it by the crate. How many shall I book you for?"
"Here you are."
"What? That's outrageous."
"You want to trade with the grown-ups, you pay grown-up prices. If you don't have the coin - too bad." She shrugs expansively and chuckles.
"It is a rare pleasure to meet someone whose coin purse is as large as their mouth." She gives you a grin that spreads from ear to tufted ear.
"Your price is one thousand five hundred copper. We only sell it by the crate. How many shall I book you for?"
Her ears twitch with barely-concealed interest.
"Can't you make an exception?"
"I cannot!" Her voice is all cheer.
"I'll take three."
"I'll take four."
"I'll take six."
"Forget it."
"That will be six thousand copper."
"That will be eight thousand copper."
"That will be twelve thousand copper."
"Here you are."
"It is a rare pleasure to meet someone whose coin purse is as large as their mouth." She gives you a grin that spreads from ear to tufted ear.
"Here you are."
"It is a rare pleasure to meet someone whose coin purse is as large as their mouth." She gives you a grin that spreads from ear to tufted ear.
"I'll take three."
"I'll take four."
"I'll take six."
"That will be four thousand five hundred copper."
"That will be six thousand copper."
"That will be nine thousand copper."
"Here you are."
"Here you are."
"Here you are."
"It is a rare pleasure to meet someone whose coin purse is as large as their mouth." She gives you a grin that spreads from ear to tufted ear.
"It is a rare pleasure to meet someone whose coin purse is as large as their mouth." She gives you a grin that spreads from ear to tufted ear.
"It is a rare pleasure to meet someone whose coin purse is as large as their mouth." She gives you a grin that spreads from ear to tufted ear.
